alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 30 at 5:25AM PST until December 30 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE LAKE, BOBCAT, DAM, AND RANCH 2 BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Lake, Bobcat, Dam, and Ranch 2 burn scar. * WHERE...The following recent burn areas of Los Angeles County, the Lake burn area near Lake Hughes, and the Bobcat, Dam, and Ranch 2 burns in the eastern San Gabriel Mountains and foothills. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding and debris flows in and around these recent burn scars. Roads may be impacted or closed and vehicles may be stranded. Localized damage to structures is possible. Residents near these burn scars should prepare for potential flash flooding and debris flow impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information and orders from local authorities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Southern California residents, in or below the recently burned areas are urged to take the steps necessary to protect their property. Persons in the watch area should remain alert and follow directions of emergency preparedness officials.

area.areaDesc: Antelope Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley
